Description: Sub-rectangular pottery basin with slightly outsplayed sides. The interior is divided into five compartments, a circular one in the centre and the others divided up along the diagonals. The central circular compartment is connected to the two on the long axis by a small hole pierced through the base of the dividing wall. Painted decoration on the rim top and along the sides. On the better preserved long side are two painted snakes.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Structure 1100 Room 3 Level 2
Curator's comments: Published (as QI.86.2.13/37): Driskell, Boyce N., Nettie K. Adams, and Peter G. French 1989. A newly discovered temple at Qasr Ibrim: preliminary report. Archéologie du Nil moyen 3, 11-54. Particularly pp. 20-21 https://sfdas.com/IMG/pdf/anm_3_-_basse_qualite.pdf
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
